programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: How to Make Croissants and Sourdough Bread
programme.desc: Martha journeys through her local area in search of the ultimate fresh-baked croissants and sourdough bread; learning about homemade bread and pastries.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: One Pot Wonders With Jamie Oliver
programme.desc: Martha is in the test kitchen with English chef, restaurateur, and author Jamie Oliver, and they're cooking up a mouth-watering menu of dishes that are easy to make.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha discusses two of the oldest preserving techniques, confit and salting, and how to use them at home: duck confit, tomato confit, and gravlax, a cured salmon appetizer

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha and chef Cesare Casella shed light on legumes, exploring the varieties and how to cook them using three different methods: stovetop, oven, and pressure cooker

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Learn about buying, storing, shelling, and deveining shrimp. Martha makes shrimp cocktail, shrimp scampi, a traditional shrimp boil, and simple grilled shrimp

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Chicken, a mainstay of the dinner table, can be prepared in many ways. Martha prepares chicken paillard, chicken pot pie, and spatchcocked chicken

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha prepares onion dishes with different cooking techniques: French onion soup, balsamic-glazed pearl onions, and fried onion rings. Plus, pickled Vidalia and red onions

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Roasting is a technique used for both formal dinners and casual gatherings. Martha makes roast rack of lamb, salt-roasted sea bass, and saffron-roasted chicken wings

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Oodles of noodles! Watch Martha make three of her favorites: Pad Thai, a one-pan pasta that's on the table in twenty minutes, and pho, considered Vietnam's national dish

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha demonstrates braising, the technique behind three iconic dishes: Italian specialty osso buco, traditional Irish corned beef, and lamb shanks with aromatic spices

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha likes to mark a special celebration with a homemade layer cake: sprinkle cake, hedgehog cake, and Alexis' heart cake

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares how to bake dark for maximum flavor: sticky toffee pudding, mini apricot tartes tatin, pear tart, and no-knead seeded overnight bread

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares coconut desserts: coconut lemon cake, coconut cookies, frozen coconut and roasted pineapple cake (guest Michelle Goldsmith), and coconut crunch cake

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shows how to make four of her favorite fruit desserts: passion fruit souffle, rhubarb-raspberry biscuit cobbler, raisin tart, and mango upside-down cake

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha incorporates luscious ganache into desserts: chocolate ganache tart, fudgy devil's food cake with chocolate ganache frosting, and milk chocolate pudding cupcakes

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha incorporates frangipane, a sweet nut cream, into desserts: bostock, Bakewell tarts, apricot-hazelnut frangipane tart, and pecan-frangipane coffee cake

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shows four cookies for every occasion: giant kitchen sink cookies, sorbet sandwiches, maple-pecan shortbread squares, and double chocolate sandwich cookies

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shows how to make pizzeria classics at home, including make-ahead pizza dough: spinach and three cheese pizza, sausage-pepper calzone, and wild mushroom skillet pizza

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha makes sweet and savory apple recipes

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha serves up a delicious chicken dinner with fresh ingredients from her greenhouse; joined by her good friend Kevin Sharkey, they celebrate the perfect meal for a taste of home-cooked goodness.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: The man behind Beal's Lobster Pier, where Martha's loves to dine in Maine, shows viewers everything they need to know about boiling lobster; then, Martha turns up the flavor with her spicy lobster linguine.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: Pizza Perfection: Sicilian and Neapolitan-Style Pizzas
programme.desc: Martha serves up delicious homemade pizzas alongside friends and pizza chefs Christian Petroni and Dean Medico; featuring classic pizzas, signature sauces, and more.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: Japanese Cuisine: Sushi, Sashimi and More
programme.desc: Martha visits the Japanese restaurant Joji in the heart of New York, where Chef George Ruan shares his secrets for the ultimate omakase experience; culinary giant Daniel Boulud stops by.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha starts off brunch with a citrus cocktail Mary's knees; Chef Ignacio Mattos joins and makes an omelette with caviar and creme fraiche; Martha makes an endive salad; Martha makes waffles.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Everything You Need To Know About Conifers
programme.desc: Martha celebrates all things conifers, the cone-bearing trees that are typically evergreens. Go inside the Christmas tree farm on her Bedford farm and learn how to properly move an established tree.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha shares her love of houseplants and brings the outdoors into her home. Learn all about the most popular and sought after houseplants, topiaries and begonias and how to take care of them.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Succulents are known for their vibrant colors, interesting textures, and often beautiful blooms. Martha explores how best to care for succulents including watering, fertilizing, and repotting.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Inside Martha's Vegetable Greenhouse; Seed Starting
programme.desc: Martha takes us inside her vegetable greenhouse to see how she has turned her harvest into a year-round bounty. Then, how she collects, stores, and sows seeds. Plus Martha makes her perfect green drink.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha visits the incredible Orchid Show at the New York Botanical Garden. This year's show immerses you in a mesmerizing array of orchids designed by acclaimed artist Lily Kwong.

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.sub-title: Strawberry and Banana Sherbet, Beach Chair, Garden Frittata
programme.desc: Strawberry and Banana Sherbet, Ticking Beach Chair, Tool of the Week: Long-Armed Pruner, How to Adopt a Pound Puppy (Field Trip), Garden Frittata, Game Table, Checkerboard Stones

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Fish Birthday Party: Invitations, Decorations, Wood Fish Cutouts, Goody Bags Good Thing, Fish-Shaped Cake, Aging Cement Planter, Steel Tuteurs at J & K Welding (Field Trip)

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.sub-title: Frontera Bar and Grill Sopes, Pistachio Shortbread Cookies
programme.desc: Frontera Bar and Grill Sopes, Cookie of the Week: Pistachio Shortbread, Rainy Day S'mores Good Thing, AskMartha: Photos Stuck in Albums, Crab Cakes, Tartar Sauce, Making a Pinata

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.sub-title: All-Purpose Soil Mix, Wave Hill's Alpine House
programme.desc: All-Purpose Soil Mix, Customizing Pre-Packaged Soil, Alpine House at Wave Hill (Field Trip), Cookie of the Week: Chocolate Mint Wafer, Drawer Waxing Good Thing

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and her niece Sophie visit their favorite tea shop, Arogya, in Westport, Conn., to discover the do's and don'ts of making tea; they return to Martha's kitchen to create dishes with tea.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits Mast Market in Mt. Kisco, N.Y., and learns the art behind making their renowned chocolate; from roasting cacao, to stone grinding, to forming delicious bars and chips.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha shares techniques for making the perfect burgers; Pat LaFrieda joins Martha to grind his beef mix; Thomas Joseph joins to make a hake fish burger and Martha shares her turkey burger.

programme.sub-title: Martha Throws an Argentine Asado BBQ
programme.desc: Martha throws an Argentinian Asado BBQ at Bedford

programme.desc: Martha makes her favorite jam recipes

programme.desc: Martha demonstrates egg recipes; Martha visits her chicken coop

programme.desc: Martha and her friends make three pasta dishes

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; join Martha while she creates new garden with almost 200 roses.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Welcome to Martha's woodland gardens. Martha's azalea grove is bursting with the last flowers of spring. Everything you need to know about hostas. Martha takes up bird watching.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings
programme.desc: Welcome to Martha's passion project: the maze on her Bedford farm. Learn how to properly plant trees including measuring, fertilizing, and watering. Plus, how to start trees from seedlings.
